Package applicationLayer

Class DomainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • applicationLayer.DomainController
  • public class DomainController
extends java.lang.Object
    The DomainController performs initial checks on the parameters and forwards the requests to the relevant controller.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    group17

    • Method Detail

      • addBlock

        public void addBlock​(BlockType blockType,
                     java.lang.String connectedBlockId,
                     ConnectionType connection)
        Add a block of the given blockType to the domain and connect it with the given connectedBlockId on the given connection
        Parameters:
        blockType - The type of block to be added, this parameter is required.
        connectedBlockId - The ID of the block to connect to, can be empty.
        connection - The connection of the connected block on which the new block must be connected. If no connectedBlockId was given, this parameter must be set to "ConnectionType.NOCONNECTION".
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - There can't be a block added with the given parameters because either: - the given blockType or the given connection are null - the given connectedBlockId is empty and the connection isn't equal to ConnectionType.NOCONNECTION - the given connectedBlockId is not empty and the connection is equal to ConnectionType.NOCONNECTION
        InvalidBlockConnectionException - The given combination of the blockType,connectedBlockId and connection is impossible. - an ExecutableBlock added to an AssessableBlock or ControlBlock as condition - an AssessableBlock added to a block as a body or "next block" - a block added to another block of which the required connection is not provided. - a block added to a connection of a connected block to which there is already a block connected.
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a connectedBlockId is given that is not present in the domain.
        MaxNbOfBlocksReachedException - The maximum number of blocks in the domain is reached, no extra blocks can be added.
        Events:
        AddBlockEvent - Fires an AddBlockEvent if the execution was successful.
        PanelChangeEvent - Fires a PanelChangeEvent if the maximum number of block has been reached after adding a block.

      • moveBlock

        public void moveBlock​(java.lang.String topOfMovedChainBlockId,
                      java.lang.String movedBlockId,
                      java.lang.String connectedAfterMoveBlockId,
                      ConnectionType connectionAfterMove)
        Move a block that has been added in the domain to change the program you are constructing. If you're program is in a Execution state this action will, if successful, reset your game state.
        Parameters:
        topOfMovedChainBlockId - The Id of block to be moved, if you move a chain of blocks this will be the first block in the chain, this parameter is required.
        movedBlockId - The Id of block that's actually being moved, this might be the same as the topOfMovedChainBlockId, if the movedBlockId is empty the topOfMovedChainBlockId will be used in any way.
        connectedAfterMoveBlockId - The Id of the block you wish to connect the block you are moving to. This parameter is Required. If there's no connected block after the move please use an empty String, "".
        connectionAfterMove - The connection of the block you wish to connect the block you are moving to. This parameter is Required. If there's no connected block after the move please use ConnectionType.NOCONNECTION.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This Exception when thrown will result in a non execution of the expected changes. This means that the block you wish to move will not be modified. This exception is thrown when; - The Id of the "moved block" is null or an empty String. - One of the ConnectionTypes is null or if it does not exist. - If a "connected block"-id is either a null or a empty String and the ConnectionType is not NOCONNECTION.
        InvalidBlockConnectionException - The given combination of the blockType,connectedBlockId and connection is impossible. - an ExecutableBlock added to an AssessableBlock or ControlBlock as condition - an AssessableBlock added to a block as a body or "next block" - a block added to another block of which the required connection is not provided. - a block added to a connection of a connected block to which there is already a block connected.
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a connectedBlockId is given that is not present in the domain.
        Events:
        changeBlockEvent - Fires an changeBlockEvent if the execution was successful.
        UpdateGameStateEvent - Fires an UpdateGameStateEvent if the execution was successful.
        ResetExecutionEvent - Fires a ResetExecutionEvent if the execution was successful.

      • removeBlock

        public void removeBlock​(java.lang.String blockID)
        Removes a block with the given blockID from the domain.
        Parameters:
        blockID - The blockID of the block to be removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given BlockID is null or an empty String
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - If the given BlockID doesn't result in a block in the domain.
        Events:
        RemoveBlockEvent - Fires an RemoveBlockEvent if the execution was successful.
        UpdateGameStateEvent - Fires an UpdateGameStateEvent if the execution was successful.
        ResetExecutionEvent - Fires a ResetExecutionEvent if the execution was successful.
        PanelChangeEvent - Fires a PanelChangeEvent if the maximum number of block was reached before removing the block.

      • getAllHeadBlocks

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllHeadBlocks()
        Retrieve a set containing the id's of all headBlocks
        Returns:
        a set with the id's of all the headblocks

      • getAllBlockIDsUnderneath

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllBlockIDsUnderneath​(java.lang.String blockID)
        Returns all the BlockID's underneath a certain block
        Parameters:
        blockID - The blockID of the Block of which you want to retrieve all Blocks underneath.
        Returns:
        A set containing the blockID's of all connected Conditions and every kind of block in the body of the given block or under the given block. The ID of the block itself is also given.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown when the given blockID is empty or null.
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a blockID is given that is not present in the domain.

      • getAllBlockIDsBelowCertainBlock

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllBlockIDsBelowCertainBlock​(java.lang.String blockID)
        Returns all the BlockID's below a certain block
        Parameters:
        blockID - The blockID of the Block of which you want to retrieve all Blocks below.
        Returns:
        A set containing the blockID's of every kind of block under the given block. The ID of the block itself is also given.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown when the given blockID is empty or null.
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a blockID is given that is not present in the domain.

      • getAllBlockIDsInBody

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllBlockIDsInBody​(java.lang.String blockID)
        Returns all the blockID's in the body of a given ControlBlock
        Parameters:
        blockID - The blockID of the controlBlock of which you want to retrieve all Blocks in the body.
        Returns:
        A set containing the blockID of the blocks in the body of the given ControlBlock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown when the given blockID is empty or null.
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a blockID is given that is not present in the domain.
        InvalidBlockTypeException - Is thrown when given blockID isn't the ID of a ControlBlock.

      • checkIfConnectionIsOpen

        public java.lang.Boolean checkIfConnectionIsOpen​(java.lang.String blockToCheck,
                                                 ConnectionType connection,
                                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> changingBlocks)
        Check if the connection is open and can be used to perform a move or add on.
        Parameters:
        blockToCheck - The id of the block to check the connection from
        connection - The connection to check on the given block
        changingBlocks - A set with the id's of all blocks that are changing at the moment as to keep in measure that if the blockToCheck is connected to one of the blocks in this set that connection will be removed after the operation and hence can be ignored. If this parameter is null an empty set will be used and the method won't keep in mind any possible changed blocks.
        Returns:
        A flag indicating if the given connection for the given block is open.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the blockToCheck is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the Connection is null
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a blockID is given that is not present in the domain.

      • getBlockType

        public BlockType getBlockType​(java.lang.String id)
        Retrieve the blockType of the block associated with the given id;
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the block to retrieve the Blocktype from.
        Returns:
        the blockType associated with the given block

      • isBlockPresent

        public boolean isBlockPresent​(java.lang.String id)
        Check if the given id is present in the domain.
        Parameters:
        id - the id to check
        Returns:
        a flag indication if a block is present in the domain.

      • addGameListener

        public void addGameListener​(GUIListener listener)
        Adds a GUI listener for Game, this listener will be notified about all changes for the GUI. If the given listener is already a listener for Game it will not be added another time.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown when the given listener is null.

      • removeGameListener

        public void removeGameListener​(GUIListener listener)
        Removes a GUI listener for Game, this listener will no longer be notified about any changes for the GUI. If the GUI listener is no listener Game it also won't be removed.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown when the given listener is null.

      • isGameExecutionUseful

        public boolean isGameExecutionUseful()
        Is it useful to perform an execution step at the moment. An execution step is useful if it changes anything, otherwise it's just a waste of time and resources.
        Returns:
        if it's useful to perform an execution step at the moment.

      • isGameResetUseful

        public boolean isGameResetUseful()
        Is it useful to perform a reset of the gameWorld at the moment. A reset of the gameWorld is useful if it changes anything, otherwise it's just a waste of time and resources.
        Returns:
        if it's useful to perform a reset of the gameWorld at the moment.
